properties.areaDesc: Penobscot Bay; Casco Bay; Coastal Waters from Port Clyde, ME to Cape Elizabeth, ME out 25 NM; Coastal Waters from Cape Elizabeth, ME to Merrimack River, MA out 25 NM
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 17 at 5:59PM EST until January 18 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, northwest winds 15 to 25
kt with gusts up to 35 kt and seas 3 to 6 feet. For the
Freezing Spray Advisory, light accumulation of freezing spray.

* WHERE...Penobscot Bay, Coastal Waters from Port Clyde, ME to
Cape Elizabeth, ME out 25 NM, Casco Bay and Coastal Waters
from Cape Elizabeth, ME to Merrimack River, MA out 25 NM.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until midnight EST
tonight. For the Freezing Spray Advisory, until 6 AM EST
Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in freezing spray is hazardous.
Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic components
inoperative. Ice accretion on decks and superstructures may
result in some loss of stability. Conditions will be hazardous
to small craft.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for accumulation of ice on their vessel
and consider altering plans to avoid or mitigate these hazardous
navigating conditions.

Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...FREEZING SPRAY ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY... ...GALE WARNING IS CANCELLED
